sub_title: Biomedical engineer | Lab automation | Service NPI
summary:
A mechanical engineer and master in Biomedical Engineering with 11 years of professional experience in different engineering roles including mechanical design, test supervision and project coordination. Excelling in customer focused delivery. Working for leading international companies, I have implemented Kaizen projects within team processes, which led to revenue and time saving, as well as quality improvements in the final product. 
I am a proactive, inclusive, responsible and well administrated person, always open to learn and with a good balance between technical abilities and social skills.

awards.title: Roberto Rocca Scholarship Awardee
awards.description: The Roberto Rocca Education Program is an initiative to provide scholarships and fellowships to talented undergraduate and graduate students of engineering and the applied sciences in selected countries. Founded in 2005 to honor the late Chairman of the Techint Group, Roberto Rocca, the Roberto Rocca Education Program is supported by the Tenaris, Ternium and Techint companies

awards.title: UDLA-P Departmental Scholarship Awardee
awards.description: Scholarship awarded for six consecutive semesters, due to consistent good grades.
awards.issuer: Fundación Universidad de las Américas, Puebla, A.C.

profile_positions.description:
•	Core Team member representing the Service department, working alongside the R&D, Operations, Quality, Regional Service and Training departments for the introduction of new products such as BD Kiestra ReadA Standalone, Identifa and Track. 
•	Development of technical service documentation necessary to perform product installation, repair, troubleshooting and maintenance.
•	Design, implementation, and optimization of service support strategies, for new product launches worldwide.
•	Driving the development of service spare parts and tools strategy, which aid in field service repairs.
•	Development, implementation and maintenance of reports, documents and presentations to communicate with a wide range of audiences within Global Tech Services and regional field service team members. 
•	Contributed to Continuous Improvement   projects within Service to improve instrument reliability, service costs and customer satisfaction. 
•	Execution of long-term strategies and short-term tactical plans to align with business goals and meet customer demands.
profile_positions.title: System Support Specialist II

profile_positions.description:
BD Kiestra is a fast growing company in the global market of (microbiological) laboratories and is highly focused on developing new concepts for analysis and work processes. BD Kiestra develops concepts for Total Lab Automation, Work Cell Automation and Benchtop Automation. 

The Customer Service desk engineer handles incoming service calls by resolving or escalating.

- Accepting service calls and register in automated incident system
- Retrieving information by means of intensive communication with the user and/or BD Kiestra employees
- Identify and classify (impact, urgency, priority) the issue
-Identify and analyze the cause of the fault with help of software applications and system data
- Providing optimal support to customers all around the globe by remotely solving questions or issues about the different systems provided by BD Kiestra. This involves inquires from the mechanic, pneumatic, electrical, electronic and software components of the system. 
- Escalating specialized issues to the next level of support.
- Coordination of actions needed to solve the issues with service engineers and/or project engineers.
-Closing of the incident in accordance with agreed Service Level Agreements. 
- Making and sending progress reports on the status of the incident to the user. Administrative handling by recording symptoms, research results, and the solution offered. (ServiceMax)
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Desk Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Working as an OTR Engineer. 
Engineering and mechanical design of different parts of the Wellhead Equipment, working along the GE O&G counterpart in Houston, USA. 
Implementation of export control and international standards such as NACE MR 0175, API 6A, among others. 
Performed project management functions within the team for several large projects. These functions included the planning and distribution of workload among the team, supervision of progress and being in constant communication with the client during the whole duration of the project. 
Trained in Project Management, Six sigma and Kaizen Methodology
profile_positions.title: Technology Project Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Trainee for Well Testing Services Segment in 2010 in France. Training in Surface Well Testing and Testing Data Acquisition, using both surface and downhole sensors. 

In 2011, performing maintenance of the test equipment, as well as preparation, designs and operations of tests and final data report delivery of these tests to the client. Participation in financial and technical proposals for International Clients. Working for different projects in Mexico, Brazil and Cuba. 

Field Engineer in Well Testing Services segment. Working in Brazil and Colombia in Surface Well Testing and Testing Data Acquisition sub-segments. In charge of maintenance, design, installation and operation of both surface and downhole sensors, as well as data delivery.
profile_positions.title: Field Engineer

volunteer_experiences.description: Stichting Haarwensen is a foundation in the Netherlands which donates wigs to children who have lost their due to medical treatment or other forms of alopecia.
